page.title: 05 AGRICULTURE IN DUNS
page.content: MOST OF THE FARMING LAND AROUND DUNS IS ARABLE, THE MAIN CROPS BEING BARLEY AND WHEAT. GRAIN IS DRIED LOCALLY AND STORED AS PART OF THE E.E.C.GRAIN MOUNTAIN. BEEF CATTLE ARE MAINLY FRIESIAN. THERE ARE SMALL NUMBERS OF SHEEP BRED MAINLY FOR LAMB,THE WOOL IS USED TO MAKE CARPETS.THERE ARE THREE CHICKEN HATCHERIES BREEDING BIRDS FOR THE TABLE. THREE VETS WORK IN AND AROUND DUNS AND HAVE SURGERIES LOCALLY. TIMBER PRODUCTION IS UNDERTAKEN AT TWO SITES AND A PROGRAMME OF REAFORESTATION IS BEING CARRIED OUT, WITH THE PLANTING OF MANY HUNDREDS OF HARDWOOD TREES.
